summary: Season 3 premiere. An examination of the global politics of a dangerous new Cold War as tensions between the U.S. and Russia are ratcheting up.

A look at the legal entanglements surrounding President Trump, including the Mueller investigation and the Michael Cohen raid. Also: interviews with attorneys Michael Avenatti and Alan Dershowitz; and former acting U.S. attorney general Sally Yates.

Mike Pompeo's nomination for Secretary of State; and state visits by French president Emmanuel Macron and German chancellor Angela Merkel are discussed. Also: former state department official Wendy Sherman on the Iran nuclear deal; Muslim Association of Hawaii imam Ismail Elshikh on President Trump's travel ban.

Celebrated Republican political strategist Steve Schmidt joins John Heilemann, Mark McKinnon and Alex Wagner as a guest host this week. From the industrial heartland to the Mountain West, and from the far North to the deep South, the team assesses Trump's impact on the national political climate, campaigns and candidates from both parties.
President Trump's first 100 days in office are the focus, as Season 2 begins.

The groundbreaking real-time political documentary series about America's presidential campaign returns, examining the unprecedented events unfolding in Donald Trump's administration. Journalists Mark Halperin and John Heilemann take the pulse of the country beyond the beltway while pulling back the curtain on a White House unlike any that has come before. -- (C) SHOWTIME

What do people outside the Beltway really think about President Trump? Mark Halperin takes a trip through America to find the answers. Then he heads to New Orleans to discuss his surprising findings with Mary Matalin.  -- (C) SHOWTIME

What in the world is going on? Mark Halperin heads to Palm Beach for Chinese President Xi Jinping's visit to Mar-A-Lago. A revealing look at how President Trump is handling American foreign policy and our relations with China.  -- (C) SHOWTIME

Congress may be in recess but Mark Halperin is on the job, covering the White House and the Syria fallout. John Heilemann and Mark McKinnon hit the road to see what Americans think about how President Trump is handling the situation. -- (C) SHOWTIME

Mark Halperin talks with Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-Mass.) about standing strong against Trump; Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.) tells John Heilemann about taking his message to the people; Americans discuss what resistance means to them.

As Congress reconvenes, Mark McKinnon and John Heilemann head to Capitol Hill to find out what President Trump has learned in his first 100 days in office. Also, Mark Halperin goes to New York City to get Wall Street's perspective.

Washington insiders join John Heilemann, Mark Halperin and Mark McKinnon for a look at some of the thrilling, amazing and logic defying acts performed during President Trump's first 100 days. Season finale. -- (C) SHOWTIME
A real-time documentary series that offers a revealing look at the 2016 presidential race. In the opener, Ted Cruz, Bernie Sanders and Donald Trump campaign in Iowa.
A real-time documentary series that offers a revealing look at the 2016 presidential race.

A look at the angst and drama leading up to the Iowa Caucuses, with a showdown brewing between Democrats Bernie Sanders and Hillary Clinton, and the GOP's first real test of outsider candidates versus the establishment.
A look at the Iowa fallout and an examination of who has momentum going into the New Hampshire primary, and whether Trump and Clinton can pick up the pace to beat back the surging Cruz and Sanders.
The candidates deal with the jolt that was New Hampshire and prepare for hard truths in South Carolina and Nevada.
Anxiety grows among the candidates about the high stakes in South Carolina and Nevada, and the significance of falling behind.

With the field narrowed down to The Big Five, the campaigns spread their game across the country and play to their strengths--with eyes squarely focused on the all-important upcoming prize: Super Tuesday.
Candidates who trail the front-runners deal with the results of Super Tuesday, while the Democratic and Republican establishments try to find a way to stop Trump.
Rubio, Kasich and Sanders pin their hopes on Florida and Ohio in hopes of gaining enough momentum to force a brokered convention.
As Rubio gets trumped in Florida, the rest of the field remains optimistic.  -- (C) Showtime

A second wave of aliens, whose planet has been destroyed, takes over control of the Earth invasion from the Advocacy. John Kincaid: Adrian Paul. Malzor: Denis Forest. Mana: Catherine Disher. Norton: Philip Akin. Ironhorse: Richard Chaves.

Harrison and Suzanne leave their ruined headquarters for Kincaid's underground hideout, while a homeless man (Angelo Rizacos) witnesses the aliens abducting a priest. Malzor: Denis Forest. Kincaid: Adrian Paul. Mana: Catherine Disher. Harrison: Jared Martin.

The Morthrens take control of a city by cutting off the water supply, and clone a minister (Kurt Reis) to preach the word of the Eternal. Grace: Diana Reis. Steven: Nathaniel Moreau. Kincaid: Adrian Paul. Ardix: Julian Richings. Bayda: Patricia Phillips.
Mana (Catherine Disher) subjugates a violent street gang by inserting subliminal commands in their music. Suzanne: Lynda Mason Green. Debi: Rachel Blanchard. Kincaid: Adrian Paul.

The Morthrens recruit a terminally ill doctor to experiment with grafting alien embryos into human surrogates. Kate: Helen Hughes. Harrison: Jared Martin. Suzanne: Lynda Mason Green. Kincaid: Adrian Paul. Malzor: Denis Forest.

Harrison aids a woman from Emun who's being held hostage by Mana, but Kincaid fears she's conspiring with the Morthrens to expose the group's whereabouts. Malzor: Denis Forest. Kincaid: Adrian Paul. Harrison: Jared Martin. Mana: Catherine Disher.
Debi befriends a teenage alien (Keram Malicki Sanchez) who's playing hooky from his training. Malzor: Denis Forest. Debi: Rachel Blanchard. Harrison: Jared Martin. Kincaid: Adrian Paul.

Suzanne endangers herself and Debi when they go to her mother's farm, which has been taken over by Morthrens for experiments. John: Ken Pogue. Paul: Wayne Best. Suzanne: Lynda Mason Green. Debi: Rachel Blanchard.

The aliens create a behavior-control drug made with brain tissue and convince the head of a pharmaceutical company (Vlasta Vrana) to distribute it through rehab clinics. Mr. Jimmy: Sam Malkin. Rene Laporte: Catherine Rose. Bayda: Patricia Phillips.

A Morthren (Charles McCaughan) is disfigured when an energy surge he sends to kill a computer hacker (Charles Kerr) backfires on him. Scoggs: Belinda Metz. Lonelyheart: Alan Feiman. Kincaid: Adrian Paul. Mana: Catherine Disher.
In the opener, nuclear waste revives the aliens and their radio signals draw two scientists to the dump site. Part 1 of two. Harrison Blackwood: Jared Martin. Suzanne McCullough: Lynda Mason Green.

Conclusion. While Harrison and Suzanne work in their secret command post, Norton intercepts radio signals that warn of an imminent alien attack. Harrison: Jared Martin. Suzanne: Lynda Mason Green. Iron-horse: Richard Chaves. Norton: Philip Akin.

Suzanne and Harrison are convinced that a series of seemingly random crimes is related to the alien invasion. Jared Martin, Lynda Mason Green. Iron-horse: Richard Chaves. General Wilson: John Vernon. Chamber: Richard M. Comar.

Blackwood's stepmother (Ann Robinson), who witnessed the original invasion and is now confined to a mental hospital, experiences violent seizures and psychic visions. Blackwood: Jared Martin. McCullough: Lynda Mason Green. Ironhorse: Richard Chaves.
A TV reporter (Michele Scarabelli) investigating radioactive waste witnesses---and tapes---an alien absorbing a truck driver. Jared Martin, Lynda Mason Green. Ironhorse: Richard Chaves.

While the townspeople of Grover's Mill, N.J., prepare to celebrate the 50th anniversary of Orson Welles' Halloween broadcast, the aliens, disguised as a motorcycle gang, plot to recapture their spaceship. Lynda Mason Green. Harrison Blackwood: Jared Martin. Ironhorse: Richard Chaves.

Harrison, Suzanne and Ironhorse race against the aliens to retrieve the secret Government file on the 1953 invasion, code-named "Operation Deep Ice." Jared Martin, Lynda Mason Green, Richard Chaves. Norton: Philip Akin. Gen. Masters: Greg Morris. Amanda Burke: Lynne Griffin.
Suzanne's former lab assistant disappears when the aliens invade a college campus to steal a lethal virus. Lynda Mason Green. Harrison: Jared Martin. Ironhorse: Richard Chaves. Norton: Philip Akin.

A member of the alien triumvirate known as The Advocacy falls ill, and the need for brain-power reaches the crisis point. Sylvia: Ann Robinson. Harrison: Jared Martin. Suzanne: Lynda Mason Green. Ironhorse: Richard Chaves. Norton: Philip Akin.

An breakthrough that could end world hunger draws Suzanne---and the aliens---to a rendezvous with the inventor (Alex Cord). Lynda Mason Green. Teri: Lori Hallier. Harrison: Jared Martin. Norton: Philip Akin. Ironhorse: Richard Chaves.

Sabrina flies solo when a newly married Hilda and a suddenly youthful Zelda both take off. The remaining Spellman witch sets out to find a job, but nothing seems to pan out until Morgan wins an MTV writing contest that whisks the gal pals to New York, where they go on the set of "TRL" and see host Carson Daly. Roxie: Soleil Moon Frye. Morgan: Elisa Donovan. Sabrina: Melissa Joan Hart.

Sabrina starts her first day of work as a reporter and actually gets to interview a rock star (Howard Dorough) the same day. Back at the house, Morgan and Roxie decide to train Salem. They begin with the purchase of a collar, which proves a shock for the magical cat. Morgan: Elisa Donovan. Roxie: Soleil Moon Frye.

Sabrina tries to fit in with her co-workers at Scorch magazine, but her attempts backfire when people start to believe she's bonkers. Still, her peers may think she's crazy like a fox when she lands an interview with singer Ashanti. Cole: Andrew Walker. James: Bumper Robinson. Leonard: John Ducey.

Sabrina is terrified to interview a hip-hop diva (Da Brat) known for her mean streak. But a spell to make the singer nicer backfires, causing Sabrina and the star to swap personalities. Sabrina: Melissa Joan Hart. Annie: Diana-Maria Riva.

Sabrina sets out to expose a famous actress (Clare Kramer) as a kleptomaniac after she sees the star shoplifting in a boutique. She devises a plan to catch the sticky-fingered diva in the act, but when it backfires Sabrina ends up in the hands of the police. Morgan: Elisa Donovan. Annie: Diana-Maria Riva. Roxie: Soleil Moon Frye.

Sabrina (Melissa Joan Hart) is outraged when Webcams are put in the office---and shocked when they catch her using her powers, so she tries to find a way to destroy the evidence. Meanwhile, Roxie and Morgan fight over a drummer they'd both like to date. Leonard: John Ducey. Annie: Diana-Maria Riva. Roxie: Soleil Moon Frye.

Sabrina meets the handsome owner (Austin Peck) of an art gallery, and decides to make a date with him instead of going out with her friends. But she has a change of heart when she realizes he may want to add her to his collection of exotic creatures. Angus: Verne Troyer. Roxie: Soleil Moon Frye. Morgan: Elisa Donovan.

Avril Lavigne makes a guest appearance on this episode, which finds Sabrina with a hot story about a nightclub singer (Richard Voll). But Sabrina may not be able to publish the scoop after the owner of the club finds out about it. Meanwhile, Morgan and Roxie decide to hire a maid to help them tidy up the house. Mickey: Garry Marshall. Annie: Diana-Maria Riva. Roxie: Soleil Moon Frye.

Sabrina, Roxie and Morgan (Elisa Donovan) celebrate the holidays in Miami, where Roxie is surprised to learn her mom is also staying. But Salem may spend the Yuletide in a kennel after Sabrina finds out pets aren't allowed in their condo. Leonard: John Ducey. Candy: Kate Jackson. Roxie: Soleil Moon Frye.

Sabrina, Roxie and Morgan decide to audition for a television talent show, where singers compete for a record deal. But the magic Sabrina uses to help the group hit their notes might have some serious side effects that could ruin the girls' friendship. Aunt Lorraine: Sally Struthers. Colin: Chris Harrison. Zeke: Drew Lachey.

Sabrina and Miles team up to make a student horror film that includes a mysterious performer (Sisqo) who seems too good to be true. Meanwhile, Hilda and Zelda are summoned to the Other Realm for Scare Duty. Miles: Trevor Lissauer. Hilda: Caroline Rhea.

Sabrina anxiously awaits the return of her boyfriend, Josh, who was in Prague for the summer. But he receives an offer that could change their relationship. Meanwhile, Zelda decides to host a party for the president of Adams College. Josh: David Lascher. Zelda: Beth Broderick. Hilda: Caroline Rhea.

Miles is on a documentary kick and follows Sabrina, Roxie, Morgan and the aunts around to find out what women want in a man. Meanwhile, Josh finds a job as a photographer for the the Boston Citizen; and Morgan's date turns out to be a surprise for Sabrina. Josh: David Lascher. Morgan: Elisa Donovan. Miles: Trevor Lissauer.

Sabrina takes a holiday idea from Salem and brings her friends on the spooky Mystery Train for a Halloween adventure. There's just one problem: It's in the Other Realm. Sabrina soon learns that the mortals can leave only if she solves the puzzling mystery. Sabrina: Melissa Joan Hart. Josh: David Lascher. Roxie: Soleil Moon Frye.

Sabrina and Roxie land a radio show at the campus station. Roxie seems to have the gift of gab when on the air, but Sabrina clams up. Meanwhile, online bidder Miles wins a cardboard cutout of "Swamp Thing" star Adrienne Barbeau, who has a cameo. Miles: Trevor Lissauer. Roxie: Soleil Moon Frye. Sabrina: Melissa Joan Hart.

Sabrina's ex-boyfriend Harvey gets a hockey injury and needs help, so Sabrina goes to Mercury to get the god's special ice skates. But Sabrina has to pay the deity back when Harvey's coach has the skates bronzed to celebrate the team's victory. Harvey: Nate Richert. Mercury: Patrick Bristow. Zues: Dion Anderson.

Sabrina gets an internship at the newspaper where Josh works but she doesn't want to just be known as the photojournalist's girlfriend, so she decides to keep their relationship a secret. Meanwhile, Hilda takes Morgan with her to the Other Realm to shop for jewelry. Josh: David Lascher. Morgan: Elisa Donovan. Hilda: Caroline Rhea.

Morgan spends all her cash when she goes on a shopping spree and has to borrow money from Sabrina, Roxie and Miles to pay her share of the rent. Meanwhile, Zelda and Salem join the Other Realm book club, and Hilda goes to a dinner party at Banning's house. Morgan: Elisa Donovan. Roxie:Soleil Moon Frye. Miles: Trevor Lissauer.

Sabrina wants to spend her birthday with her boyfriend, Josh, but her Aunt Irma (Barbara Eden) comes to visit from the Other Realm and puts Harvey on trial because he knows Sabrina is a witch. Meanwhile, Roxie's ex-boyfriend (Isaac Hanson) drops in to see her.

Sabrina's in-box is filled with annoying e-mails from her evil Other Realm twin. She responds by asking for the junk mail to stop, but her correspondent gets angry and sends Sabrina an e-mail virus that turns her into an airhead. Sabrina: Melissa Joan Hart. Harvey: Nate Richert. Zelda: Beth Broderick.

Worrywarts Hilda and Zelda grapple with Sabrina's decision to fly the nest and live at college, where their niece has issues with her new roommate, Roxie (Soleil Moon Frye). Sabrina: Melissa Joan Hart. Hilda: Caroline Rhea. Zelda: Beth Broderick.

In an attempt to juggle her hectic academic and social calendars, Sabrina casts a too-good-to-be-true speed spell so she can fly faster than time. Meanwhile, Zelda accepts a position as associate professor at the college, much to the chagrin of her independently minded niece. Roxie: Soleil Moon Frye. Josh: David Lascher. Morgan: Elisa Donovan. Salem: Nick Bakay.

To make herself more comfortable with dating new people, Sabrina casts a spell ensuring she'll say yes every time she's asked out. Meanwhile, Hilda takes over ownership of the coffeehouse and scares off most of her customers in the process. Roger Lodge, host of "Blind Date," has a cameo. Josh: David Lascher. Roxie: Soleil Moon Frye.

While at an Other Realm amusement park, Sabrina runs into her shifty evil twin, Katrina, who's set on sabotaging Sabrina's life. Alec: Charles Shaughnessy. Morgan: Elisa Donovan. Miles: Trevor Lissauer.
Sabrina and Roxie team up to write a story for their school newspaper and go undercover as rushees for Morgan's sorority, Mu Pi. Roxie: Soleil Moon Frye. Hilda: Caroline Rhea. Morgan: Elisa Donovan.

After she learns Hilda and Zelda won't be home for Halloween, Sabrina decides to throw a party at their place---and soon regrets the decision. Directed by Melissa Joan Hart. Roxie: Soleil Moon Frye. Voice of Salem: Nick Bakay.

Sabrina fears the social group she urged Miles to join is really a cult, with a leader (Richard Kline) who claims to be a witch. Meanwhile, Salem is catnapped by a delivery boy who hears him talk. Miles: Trevor Lissauer. Salem: Nick Bakay.

After a few great dates with another witch (Bryan Kirkwood), Sabrina is disheartened when she learns his bigoted father can't stand mortals. Dr. Axelrod: David Garrison. Zelda: Beth Broderick. Sabrina: Melissa Joan Hart.

Zelda visits Sabrina's English professor (David Starzyk) to criticize him for being such a hard grader, but winds up dating him. Suddenly, Sabrina gets an A, which she fears she doesn't deserve. Zelda: Beth Broderick. Salem: Nick Bakay.

Sabrina spends Christmas with Morgan's family and soon finds that the dysfunctional Cavanaughs are by no means perfect. Meanwhile, Hilda and Zelda scrap their original plans so they can give Roxie the traditional Christmas she never had. Mr. Cavanaugh: Tom Virtue. Mrs. Cavanaugh: Molly Cheek. Chip: Craig Zimmerman.

Britney Spears guests to help Sabrina face her 18th birthday, and her loneliness after Valerie moves and Harvey dumps her. Meanwhile, Hilda and Zelda try to hold it together when she jets off to Paris to live with her dad (Doug Sheehan). Brad: Jon Huertas. Gail: Jacqueline Schultz. Mr. Kraft: Martin Mull. Voice of Salem: Nick Bakay. Custodian: Jerry Hauck.

Teen sorceress Dreama (China Shavers) shows up to train with Sabrina, and ends up giving Brad a whiff of their witchy ways. Meanwhile, Zelda goes cuckoo after Hilda buys a clock shop filled with unsellable stock. Brad: Jon Huertas. Shop Owner: Joe Ochman. Gretchen: Nicole Nieth. Billy: Paul Blake.

Sabrina turns green with envy, literally, after Harvey and Brad (Jon Huertas) become best friends, triggering a case of Jealotosis. Meanwhile, Mr. Kraft's prefect brother arrives, setting off an infectious strain of sibling rivalry between Hilda and Zelda. Wally: Gary Sandy. Zelda: Beth Broderick. Mr. Kraft: Martin Mull.

During a visit from the Spellman matriarch (Shirley Jones), Sabrina, Hilda and Zelda learn that they may not be family after all. Meanwhile, a watch salesman ticks off the ladies by opening a stand in front of the clock store. Harvey: Nate Richert. Zelda: Beth Broderick. Voice of Salem: Nick Bakay.

Credit-card carrier Sabrina catches get-itis and begins to spoil herself...literally, and tries to cure it by donating magic mementos to a yard sale. Unfortunately, the charmed tchotchkes belong to Hilda and Zelda, who want them back. Mr. Kraft: Martin Mull. Mrs. Quick: Mary Gross. Brad: Jon Heurtas. Sparky: Spencer Beglaria. Harvey: Nate Richert. Voice of Salem: Nick Bakay.

Edgar Allan Poe IV appears as his famed namesake on a Halloween episode in which Sabrina battles an army of zombies who take over the coffee shop for a dead man's party. Meanwhile, Hilda and Zelda try to overcome their been-there-scared-of-that boredom by conjuring up a dinner date with a noted nightmare maker; and Salem looks for someone, anyone, to listen to his tales of terror. Dreama: China Shavers. Harvey: Nate Richert. Brad: Jon Huertas.

Sabrina enlists Dreama to zap her into two places at once after she agrees to help Josh study on the night of Harvey's big football game. Meanwhile, the aunts begin to treasure their free time when a trio of pirates start doing the housework. Billy Blanks, B. Smith and Ed McMahon have cameos. Josh: David Lascher. Dreama: China Shavers.

Sabrina zaps on a skin cream to appear more mature after college-guy Josh (David Lascher) shoots down a romance because of her age. But the fast-acting lotion ends up being a rapid-aging potion. Meanwhile, Hilda and Zelda try to reunite a famed French scientist with her brokenhearted beau. Paula Abdul has a cameo. Marie Curie: Pamela Dillman. Dreama: China Shavers. Pierre: Alastaire Duncan.

Consumed with guilt over kissing Josh, Sabrina runs herself ragged trying to cook up a way to get Harvey (Nate Richert) to forgive her without having to say she's sorry. Meanwhile, Zelda and Hilda force a pair of witch-hating Pilgrims to prepare Thanksgiving dinner. Dreama: China Shavers. Mary: Jennifer Butt. Colette: Ginger Williams. John: Christopher Rich.

Sabrina is unable to use magic to save the day after uninvited witch-hunter Brad (Jon Huertas) joins her and Harvey on a doomed ski trip. Meanwhile, her aunts help Brad's dad track down the three lost travellers without any aid from the Outer Realm. Mr. Alcerro: Tim Thomerson. Harvey: Nate Richert. Zelda: Beth Broderick.

Sabrina earns her witch's license, but isn't allowed to use it. So she must decide between Harvey and Dash (Donald Faison) on her own. Dash: Donald Faison. Doris: Carol Ann Susi. Yuri: Rick Cramer. Sabrina: Melissa Joan Hart.

After Val (Lindsay Sloane) burps in front of a boy, Sabrina casts an anti-embarrassment spell. But the humiliation is transferred to Sabrina, who passes gas in class. Justin: Corbin Allred. Dr. Werner: Karen Witter.

Sabrina gets jealous when a class assignment calls for students to pair up and pretend to be married---and Libby gets Harvey (Nate Richert). Gordie: Curtis Anderson. Roland: Phil Fondacaro. Sabrina: Melissa Joan Hart.

Val (Lindsay Sloane) wants to be a cheerleader, but Sabrina hates the pom-pompous squad. So she tries to change Val's mind with a magic coin from a cousin (Dom DeLuise). Libby: Jenna Leigh Green. Sabrina: Melissa Joan Hart.

Sabrina (Melissa Joan Hart) makes a glutton of herself in school after tasting a substance that causes addiction in her family: pancakes. Meanwhile, Hilda is deported to the Other Realm. Hilda: Caroline Rhea.

Sabrina gets a creepy doll from her aunt (Jo Anne Worley), and it brings monster party crashers to her Halloween soiree. Delilah: Ruth Buzzi. Gary Owens: Himself. Bellevuedere: Alan Sues. Doctor: Dave Madden.

Salem gambles with a high roller (Edward Albert) from the Other Realm---and loses Hilda, Zelda and Sabrina to him. C.K.: Fred Stoller. Sabrina: Melissa Joan Hart. Zelda: Beth Broderick. Voice of Salem: Nick Bakay.

Hungry for praise, Sabrina (Melissa Joan Hart) conjures up a cake that will ensure she gets her just desserts. Dick Clark has a cameo. Larry: Joel Brooks. Olga: Suzanne Krull. Zampano: Larry Thomas. Zelda: Beth Broderick.

Sabrina and Salem are transported into a tiny spaceship and fly into Libby's nose; and Hilda gives Zelda magic candy to make her loathe Willard. Sabrina: Melissa Joan Hart. Voice of Salem: Nick Bakay. Libby: Jenna Leigh Green.

Harvey and an appearance-obsessed Sabrina win a cute-couple contest, and her unattractive cousin vows to teach her a lesson about looks. Jose Eber has a cameo. Susie: Sonje Fortag. Sabrina: Melissa Joan Hart.

Part 1. With her scholastic and social duties piling up, Sabrina has no time to spend with Harvey or study for her witch's license. Mrs. Quick: Mary Gross. Quizmaster: Alimi Ballard. Mr. Kraft: Martin Mull.

Conclusion. Sabrina busts out of boot camp and ditches her duds to go to Harvey's dance, but exits quickly after she turns back into a rookie. Erik Estrada has a cameo. Mrs. Quick: Mary Gross. Sgt. Slater: Richard Moll.

Sabrina tries to convince Hilda to date Mr. Kraft, hoping the encounter will improve his opinion of Sabrina. Hilda: Caroline Rhea. Zelda: Beth Broderick. Harvey: Nate Richert. Sabrina: Melissa Joan Hart.

Forced to date others, Sabrina and Harvey try to ease the pain by double-dating---but Sabrina's escort has never been in the mortal realm before. Davy Jones has a cameo. Yenta: Teri Garr. Dante: Jason James Richter.

Sabrina agrees to baby-sit her cousin, but the little witch turns her into a doll. Ralphie: Paul Dooley. Carol: Donna D'Errico. Dr. Rafkin: Paul Sand. Quizmaster: Alimi Ballard. Sabrina: Melissa Joan Hart.

Sabrina turns herself into a boy and befriends Harvey's social circle. But her hoax turns hurtful when Harvey reveals an interest in Valerie. Harvey: Nate Richert. Valerie: Lindsay Sloane. Sabrina: Melissa Joan Hart.

While planning a Halloween party, Sabrina frets that her talking furniture, which is infested with talking termites, will expose her. Cameo by 10,000 Maniacs. Asher: Scott Tyler Russell. Valerie: Lindsay Sloane.
After Sabrina creates a time ball, a dieting Salem gets hungry and eats the device---sending them all back to the 1960s. Mr. Kraft: Martin Mull. Harvey: Nate Richert. Sabrina: Melissa Joan Hart.
A dispute over a will leads a trio of hillbilly cousins to lock the Spellmans---and a visiting Harvey and Valerie---in their house. Racine: Loni Anderson. Mawmaw: Edie McClurg. Boyd: Gary Grubbs.

It's Friday the 13th, a day on which Sabrina can reveal her secret to one mortal. So she decides to tell Valerie, who decides to tell Harvey---in Libby's earshot. Drew Carey and Angels pitcher Mark Langston have cameos. Sabrina: Melissa Joan Hart.

In the pilot, Sabrina celebrates her 16th birthday---her first official day as a witch---and accidentally turns a girl into a pineapple. Melissa Joan Hart. Drell and Skippy: Penn and Teller. Cassandra: Deborah Harry.

Sabrina slips Libby some truth sprinkles to make her confess to spreading lies, but the goodies cause Jenny to reveal some news: she's sweet on Sabrina's love interest, Harvey. Mrs. Bozigian: Ella Joyce. Sabrina: Melissa Joan Hart.

Sabrina's baby-sitting job, which doubles as a study date with Harvey, goes well until she accidentally turns the baby into a man. Randy Travis has a cameo. Sabrina: Melissa Joan Hart. Harvey: Nate Richert.

Sabrina uses her powers to aid Jenny in an election and help Harvey in football---without considering the possible consequences of her actions. Jenny: Michelle Beaudoin. Harvey: Nate Richert. Sabrina: Melissa Joan Hart.

When Sabrina must go to a family affair, she sends a clone to Harvey's party---where her stand-in agrees to streak naked to liven up the festivities. Sally Jessy Raphael has a cameo. Marigold: Robin Riker. Grandmother: Diane McBain.

Harvey goes to a dance with Libby, prompting Sabrina to skip the event---until her aunts use "man dough" to create her perfect date (Brian Austin Green). Harvey: Nate Richert. Libby: Jenna Leigh Green.
Sabrina visits an aunt in Pleasuredome---a realm where every wish is granted---and decides to stay for good. Hilda: Caroline Rhea. Zelda: Beth Broderick. Sabrina: Melissa Joan Hart.

Hoping to catch Harvey's eye, Sabrina becomes a magician's assistant, but the act is more comical than bewitching when the magic man's tricks misfire. Joel: Andrew Keegan. Emma: Persia White. Sabrina: Melissa Joan Hart.

Sabrina tires of Libby's teasing---which worsens when Sabrina joins a science club---so she turns the tormentor into a nerd. Sherman: Henry Cong. Cicero: Mark Fite. Matt: John Knight. Libby: Jenna Leigh Green.

Although she cheated to defeat a master kung-fu fighter, Sabrina's conscience is clear---but her trophy keeps reminding her she's a phony. Tai Twai Tse: Cary-Hiroyuki Tagawa. Gustav: Robert Dorfman. Trophy Man: Vien Hong.

In the premiere, rollercizing poetry professor Larry Henderson is arrested for the murder of his wife; and bright-eyed lawyer Josh Segal comes down from New York to the quirky town of East Peck, S.C., to defend him. After meeting his eccentric client and odd-ball team, Josh quickly realizes he's in over his head. Later, Josh and his team discover another man's DNA in the bedroom while trying to develop an alternate theory to the murder. Josh is also concerned about Larry's lack of emotion.

Josh and his team discover another man's DNA in the bedroom while trying to develop an alternate theory to the murder. Josh is also concerned about Larry's lack of emotion and obsession with a skate wrench.

After coming up bust on a match to the DNA found in Larry's bedroom, Josh and his team discover a "sex print" on the wall that leads to a new suspect. Meanwhile, Josh gets sloppy and inadvertently gives a piece of damning evidence to the prosecution.

When the new suspect turns up in a coma, Josh becomes sidetracked trying to solve this crime, eventually becoming a suspect himself. Meanwhile, prosecutor Carol Anne Keane presents the autopsy report, which reveals Larry's wife was struck by a blunt object, leading to a frantic search for the murder weapon.

A new piece of evidence emerges that leads Josh to an unlikely, and dangerous, new suspect: Larry's brother-in-law. Meanwhile, the case takes another turn when the search for the murder weapon leads Dwayne to find a dismembered human arm.

As Josh focuses on his new suspect, Larry insists on taking a lie detector test to help prove his innocence, but the results drop a bombshell on the case and the family. Dwayne briefly becomes a hometown celebrity as the man who found an arm in the lake, and the team gets a surprising new benefactor.

As Josh prepares for trial, his boss comes down from New York to check up on him and reveals a gigantic hole in his case; and Larry, unsettled by his rift with his daughter and Josh's boss being in town, takes matters into his own hands with deadly consequences.

With the trial now getting national attention, Mankiewicz decides to take over the case from Josh, throwing the team into turmoil; and when he suggests Larry plead insanity, Josh and Carol Anne Keane work together to convince Larry to stand trial.

As the trial officially begins, Josh's strategy of painting another suspect as the murderer takes a crucial blow. Meanwhile, Anne and Dwayne investigate why Larry's former lover, Alfonzo, isn't on the prosecution's witness list.

Josh tries to show the hostile jury the real Larry when they visit the crime scene before they hear the testimony of Larry's former lover, Alfonzo. Meanwhile, Anne and Dwayne search for Margaret's missing cell phone.
Mark Evans and the team face their hardest challenge so far as they dissect an entire ecosystem: the jungle. In Borneo, they erect a high-tech laboratory to look at bugs and trees.
In this program, a veterinary scientist and an anatomist team up to dissect and examine the organs of a 45-foot sperm whale that died when it was stranded in Pegwell Bay, Kent, England.
The dissection of a camel reveals the secret of its hump, and explains why it thrives in the desert environment.

This program features the dissection of a 15-foot great white shark. It also examines the shark's ability to detect electro-magnetic fields given off by other creatures, the origins of its killing bite, the evolution of its teeth and jaws, and whether the shark deserves its killer reputation.

This program features autopsies on two pythons -- one a nine-foot male, the other a 14-foot female. It also examines how the snake's flexible jaw enables it to expand its mouth around large prey, including crocodiles and how snakes evolved from four-legged lizard-like creatures.

This episode of the wildlife show that explores the inner workings of large animals features the dissections of a lion and tiger. Included: the similarities between the big cats, what enables both to roar, and why male lions have distinctive manes.
An examination of a giant squid, which has three hearts, a razor-sharp beak, and tooth-covered tentacles.
An autopsy is performed on an Asian elephant at the Royal Veterinary College in London. The pachyderm had a debilitating chronic illness.

This new science series uncovers the anatomical secrets of some of the animal kingdom's most extraordinary species and answers such age-old questions as: how did the elephant get its trunk? And how did whales evolve from land mammals? While most wildlife documentaries explain how an animal behaves, Inside Nature's Giants - made in association with the Royal Veterinary College - uses dissection, CGI and wildlife photography to show, from the inside out, how millions of years of evolution have enabled four giant species to thrive in their environmental niches. In this episode experts dissect a 65-foot, 60-ton fin whale - second only in size to its "cousin" the blue whale - that has died after being stranded off the coast of Ireland. It's a race against time as whale anatomist Joy Reidenberg flies in from New York before the animal's decomposition causes it to explode on the beach. Veterinary scientist Mark Evans helps investigate why the animal died and explores its extraordinary anatomy. Using whale-size machinery, Joy and the team set to work amidst gale force winds, driving rain, blood, intestines, evil smells and freezing conditions. Meanwhile, advancing tides threaten to engulf the whale, as the team struggles to complete the operation. Beneath the blubber, the whale's unique anatomy holds vital clues to its evolution. Using a combination of dissection and computer graphics, the programme discovers an animal whose closest living relative is the hippo. Meanwhile, evolutionary biologist Richard Dawkins explains why the whale's ancestors may have taken to the water and the evolutionary problems that had to be overcome to transform a land-based mammal into an animal that swims among fish.
Examining the anatomy of the crocodile, which hasn't changed significantly since the age of the dinosaurs.
An autopsy is performed on a young giraffe that died unexpectedly at a zoo. Experts try to determine the cause of death and gain insight into the evolution of giraffes.
